title: Marcelo Bielsa rocks up to Leeds' 100-year celebration black tie gala in TRACKSUIT and trainers
text:
Marcelo Bielsa stood out at Leeds United's 100-year anniversary gala... by turning up in his usual tracksuit and trainers attire!

The Leeds United manager, either knowingly or unintentionally, rocked up in his official club jersey, trackies and white trainers whilst his players turned up in club suits at Elland Road.

Despite Bielsa's dress sense and his position at the back of the official photograph, the Argentine definitely stands out with a host of black ties surrounding him.

Marcelo Bielsa turned up to the 100-year gala in a grey club tracksuit and white trainers

Bielsa, positioned at the back of the squad photograph, stands out amongst a host of bow ties

A host of former players and local celebrities turned up for the gala, including Robbie Keane, Vinnie Jones and boxer Josh Warrington.

Gary McAllister, Gordon Strachan, Danny Mills and Lee Bowyer were also all in attendance for the centenary celebrations.

At the event, chairman Andrea Radrizzani presented club legends and current players with their own shirt to mark the milestone.

The players for Saturday's game against Birmingham will have the honour of wearing the commemorative shirt, which is a limited edition with only 1,919 of the famous white shirts available to purchase.

A victory on Saturday could send the Whites top-of-the-table - they currently sit in fifth place, on 20 points from 11 games.
